meanings.definition: The quality or state of being insoluble.
meanings.sent1: The insolubility of the sugar in water surprised the students during the science experiment.
meanings.sent2: The insolubility of oil in water is a well-known fact.
meanings.sent3: The insolubility of the puzzle pieces in the water made the game even more challenging.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness had an insolubility that no amount of persuasion could break.
meanings.sent5: The insolubility of the ink in the water created a beautiful swirling pattern.

meanings.definition: The inability of a substance to be dissolved in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The insolubility of the salt in the oil was evident when it refused to dissolve.
meanings.sent2: The insolubility of sand in water is a common observation at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The insolubility of the ice cream in the hot coffee led to a delicious discovery.
meanings.sent4: The insolubility of their differences created a rift between the friends.
meanings.sent5: The insolubility of the pill in the water made it difficult for the patient to swallow.
